intro: Matelea maritima subsp. cearensis, commonly known as the Cearense Matelea, is a flowering plant native to northeastern Brazil. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in dry, open habitats. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
